title.narrative: UNDP Strategic Collaboration Framework on Environment and Climate Change
UNDP Strategiskt samarbetsramverk Miljö och Klimat

description.narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 UNDP has applied to Sida for funding of SEK 380 000 000 to carry out the "UNDP-Sida Strategic Collaboration Framework on Environment and Climate Change", a programme that will be implemented at the global, regional and country level during the period 2019-2023. It primarily aims at supporting the overall vision of UNDP's Strategic Plan 2018-2021: "to help countries achieve sustainable development by eradicating poverty in all its forms and dimensions, accelerate structural transformations for sustainable development and build resilience to crises and shocks". This will be made possible by providing support for the programmes's two building blocks:
1) About 80 % in support of specific UNDP-implemented projects and initiatives in three selected program areas, aimed at strengthening both thematic work, as well as integration and synergies between the areas: (a) Sustainable management and use of ecosystems; biodiversity and natural capital; (b) Sustainable water and ocean governance and (c) Improved climate measures for sustainable development, as well as the nexus area of sustainable food systems where all programme areas are included, and
2) About 20 % of the support towards strengthening the organisational capacity and performance of UNDP to facilitate the transition to more strategic, integrated and programmatic practices that tie together all the projects in the area of environment and climate change and a stronger learning that put together are expected to lead to improved and more transformative results at the country level. The aim is to contribute to a programmatic approach making the whole larger than the sum of all UNDP-implemented environment and climate change projects and decrease fragmentation.
The contribution implies that all global support from Sida to UNDP in the area of environment and climate change will be collected under one umbrella programme, including the two on-going contributions within water and oceans (Water and Ocean Governance och Ocean Innovation Challenge). All the programme areas are relevant to the strategy for Sweden's global development cooperation on sustainable environment, sustainable climate and ocean, and sustainable use of natural resources 2018-2022. In addition, the programme is fully in line with the government's strategy for cooperation with UNDP 2017 - 2021 and above all that UNDP should develop its activities in climate change, ecosystems, resilience and environmentally sustainable communities.
Between 5-10 pilot countries will be selected jointly by Sida and UNDP, focusing on the poorest countries, to carry out the activities under the Programme's two building blocks. UNDP has proposed a preliminary list of 11 countries based on a number of agreed criteria. Thes include; country demand for the support, that UNDP has a large project portfolio in the country - NDC support including support from vertical funds, a strong focus on LDC's and Sida's partner countries and that at least one small island developing state and a conflict country are included. Sida is in agreement with the proposed countries and believes that in these countries there are opportunities for UNDP to link the various projects for better results.
While UNDP will be Sida's agreement partner and is primarily responsible for implementing and coordinating the Collaboration Framework, a number of other partners (UN agencies - not least UNEP, NGOs, philantropy, private sector) will cooperate with UNDP in the implementation. An important reason why UNDP is considered the appropriate implementing partner is that UNDP has the UN operational mandate to support the partner countries in the area of "sustainable development", which Sweden has been a proponent of.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 UNDP har ansökt till Sida om SEK 380 000 000 för finansiering av "UNDP-Sida Strategiskt samarbetsramverk inom miljö och klimat", ett program som ska implementeras både på global nivå och på landnivå under perioden 2019 - 2023. Det syftar ytterst till att stödja den övergripande visionen i UNDP:s Strategiska plan 2018 - 2021 för genomförandet av Agenda 2030: "att hjälpa länder att uppnå hållbar utveckling genom att utrota fattigdomen i alla dess former och dimensioner, påskynda strukturomvandlingar för en hållbar utveckling och bygga motståndskraft mot kriser och chocker". Det kommer ske genom stöd till programmets två byggstenar:
1) Omkring 80% av stödet går till specifika UNDP-genomförda projekt och initiativ på landnivå och global nivå inom tre utvalda programområden som både syftar till att stärka det tematiska arbetet samt integration och synergier mellan områdena: (a) Hållbar förvaltning och användning av ekosystem, biologisk mångfald och naturkapital, (b) Hållbar vatten- och havsförvaltning, och (c) Förbättrade klimatåtgärder för en hållbar utveckling, samt nexusområdet Hållbara livsmedelssystem som har bäring på alla programområden, och 2) Omkring 20% av stödet går till stärkt organisatorisk kapacitet och prestation hos UNDP för att underlätta övergången till mer strategiska, integrerade och programmatiska arbetsmetoder inom miljö och klimatområdet och ett stärkt lärande. Sammantaget förväntas det leda till förbättrade och mer transformativa resultat på landnivå. Syftet är att bidra till ett programtänk som gör att helheten blir större än summan av samtliga UNDP:s miljö- och klimatprojekt och att fragmenteringen minskar.
Förslaget innebär att allt globalt stöd från Sida till UNDP inom miljö- och klimatområdet samlas under ett paraplyprogram, inklusive de pågående Sida-stödda insatserna inom vatten och hav (Water and Ocean Governance och Ocean Innovation Challenge). Samtliga dessa tematiska områden samt den kapacitetsbyggande delen är relevanta för strategin för Sveriges globala utvecklingssamarbete inom hållbar miljö, hållbart klimat och hav, samt hållbart nyttjande av naturresurser 2018 - 2022. Programmet är dessutom i linje med regeringens strategi för samarbetet med UNDP 2017 - 2021 och i synnerhet att UNDP utvecklar sin verksamhet inom klimat, ekosystem, motståndskraft och miljömässigt hållbara samhällen.
Mellan 5 - 10 pilotländer kommer gemensamt väljas ut av Sida och UNDP, med fokus på de mest fattiga länderna, för att genomföra aktiviteterna under programmets två byggstenar. UNDP har föreslagit en indikativ lista med 11 länder som utgått från ett antal överenskomna kriterier. Dessa inkluderar; efterfrågan från länderna, att UNDP har en stor projektportfölj i landet med NDC-stöd samt stöd från vertikala fonder, ett starkt fokus på LDC:s och på Sidas samarbetsländer samt åtminstone inkluderar en liten ö-nation under utveckling och ett konfliktland. Sida är överens om de föreslagna länderna och bedömer att det finns goda möjligheter för UNDP att uppnå bättre resultat på landnivå.
UNDP är Sidas avtalspart och kommer vara huvudansvarig för att genomföra och samordna programmet. En rad andra partner (FN-organ - inte minst UNEP, enskilda organisationer, filantroper och privata sektorn) kommer dessutom samverka med UNDP i genomförandet av insatsen. Ett tungt vägande skäl till att UNDP bedöms som lämplig genomförare är att UNDP har det operativa mandatet inom FN att stödja samarbetsländerna inom området ”hållbar utveckling”, en fråga där Sverige har varit drivande.

The UNDP-Sida Strategic Collaboration Framework on Environment and Climate Change will ultimately contribute to the UNDP Strategic Plan 2018-2021 and the overall objective:"to help countries to achieve sustainable development by eradicating poverty in all its forms and dimensions, accelerating structural transformations for sustainable development and building resilience to crises and shocks". In order to do so, the programme primarily aims at strengthening UNDP's organisational capacity and performance in the area of environment and climate change to be able to deliver transformative results at country level, across the Signature Solutions. By way of delivering on the outcomes and outputs of the three selected Signature Solutions - Poverty, Environment and Energy - UNDP and Sida have agreed to focus the work under the programme on three programme areas and one nexus: biodiversity and ecosystems, water and oceans, and climate change and energy, as well as the nexus area sustainable food systems and cross-cutting issues such as gender equality and conflict. Sida funds will contribute to strategic on-going and new initiatives and projects in all these areas. While the programme takes the impact, outcomes and outputs of the UNDP Integrated Results and Resources Framework (IRRF) as a point of departure; given the vision of the intervention, it has been considered necessary by both UNDP and Sida to add specific results related to UNDP's capacity development and organisational performance and the evidence of improved integration and synergies between the three programme areas on biodiversity and ecosystems, water and oceans, and climate change and energy and food systems nexus. In order to test the new working methods, technical support, coordination and knowledge management of the intervention and to generate lessons learned, between 5-10 countries in different stages of development will be selected, focusing on the poorest countries. The selection of pilot countries have been thoroughly discussed and the following criteria was used: development status (LDC/SIDS/conflict), Sida partner country, well-established NDC processes, and other funding through Multilateral Agreements and Vertical Funds. The tentative list of 11 pilot countries, which has been agreed by both Sida and UNDP, constitutes 9 LDCs (DRC, Uganda, Ethiopia, Liberia, Cambodia, Bangladesh, Myanmar, Nepal and Haiti), 1 SIDS (Vanuatu) and 1 Low-middle Income Country (Colombia). 8 of the selected pilot countries are Sida partner countries. The final selection of 5-10 pilot countries will be made by UNDP and Sida after a discussion with government counterparts and UNDP country offices and will be based on the list of 11 countries. The pilot countries will then be included in the activities in the annual work plans and budgets that Sida is to approve. At impact level, the programme is aligned with the overall objective of the Strategic Plan, as mentioned above. The outcome-level focuses on two main outcomes with three supporting outputs that are linked to each of the three Signature Solutions (based on selected results from the IRRF): Outcome 1. Advance poverty eradication in all its forms and dimensions which will be achieved through three outputs: (i) the capacity being developed across government to integrate the 2030 agenda, Paris Agreements and other international agreements into plans and budgets, (ii) that solutions are scaled up for sustainable management of natural resources, including sustainable commodities and green inclusive value chains, and (iii) that solutions are adopted to achieve universal access to clean, affordable and sustainable energy. Outcome 2. Accelerate structural transformations for Sustainable Development which will be achieved through the following three outputs: (i) that low emission and climate resilient objectives are addressed in national/sub-national/sectoral development plans and policies, (ii) that gender-responsive legal and regulatory frameworks policies and institutions are strengthened and solutions are adopted to address conservation, sustainable use and equitable benefit sharing of natural resources, and (iii) Solutions are developed, financed and applied at scale for energy efficiency and transformation to clean energy and zero-carbon development for poverty eradication and structural transformation. The suggested indicators for the outputs linked to Outcomes 1 and 2 are a mix of higher-level indicators from the UNDP Integrated Results and Resources Framework and indicators closer to the project level. The data will be gender disaggregated where relevant. Outcome 3. Strengthening UNDP internal capacity and organisational performance. which will be achieved by means of the following five indicative outputs: i) strengthened cross-cutting expertise for technical assistance in the programme areas and for gender, finance and conflict sensitivity, ii) enhanced management and coordination across thematic programme areas, iii) enhanced strategic partnership building, iv) integrated policy and programme design in line with the Social and Environmental Standards (SES) and women's economic empowerment, and v) strengthened knowledge management, monitoring and evaluation and continuous learning systems. It should be underlined that the internal capacity development is not an end in itself. It is rather a long-term process that aims at gradually strengthening UNDP's organizational performance in line with the Strategic Plan’s vision of improved and accelerated delivery of SDG results, and greater organisational efficiency, effectiveness and coordination and knowledge management for strengthened programme delivery. Knowledge management will be key in ensuring operationalisation of UNDP’s Strategic Plan and delivering on the Signature Solutions. The targets and indicators will be finalised as part of the revised results framework by early 2020. Three Programme Areas and one Nexus Area The three Programme areas and the nexus area sustainable food systems will be key in driving the achievement of results under Outcome 1 and Outcome 2. Through the programme, on-going projects and some new initiatives under each programme area and the nexus area will be supported, each with their own work plans and budgets and management structures. Below the activities under each area are further specified. A. Sustainable Management of Ecosystem, Biodiversity and Natural Capital Sida-UNDP collaboration under this area will help inform and respond to the evolving post-2020 framework of the Convention of Biological Diversity and its call for a New Deal for Nature and People. It will build on and expand the current UNDP portfolio in the area of Biodiversity and Ecosystems. Working through a variety of strategic partnerships and initiatives, this programme area will help ensure that: production and distribution systems internalise the value and loss of nature; financial flows shift towards conserving nature and maintaining ecosystem services; nature-based solutions are part of mix of solutions for tackling a wide range of global challenges; and non-traditional conservation actors from the private sector will co-lead efforts to protect biodiversity and ecosystems services. To advance these goals, the programme will focus on delivering on two linked result areas: 1) Unleashing synergies between biodiversity conservation and community development; and 2) Driving finance from natural capital depletion and increasing investment in nature. B. Sustainable Water and Oceans Governance Sida-UNDP collaboration in this area will enhance partner capacities to sustainably manage freshwater, marine and coastal resources. Governance frameworks (e.g. ecosystem-based approaches, integrated water resources management, ridge-to-reef/source-to-sea frameworks and marine spatial planning) will be strengthened through the application of experience, lessons learned, and innovation. This work will emphasize policy options that enhance equity, integrity and the scaling up of nature-based solutions. This collaboration area will support activities under UNDP’s ongoing Water and Ocean Governance Programme (WOGP) and the Ocean Innovation Challenge (both funded by Sida in 2019 and from 2020 onwards they will be incorporated under the programme) and aims to contribute towards improved aquatic biodiversity and water/ocean related work on climate change. UNDP and partners will help countries to advance integrated approaches for water resources and coastal area management and financing based on the source-to-sea principle connecting upper watershed management and downstream ocean fisheries development. The activities under this programme area are intended to deliver on the following result areas: 1) Strengthened water resources governance, and 2) Ocean Innovation and Marine Resources Management. C. Scaling up Climate Change Action for Sustainable Development The Sida-UNDP collaboration in this area builds upon UNDP’s corporate approach to support countries on Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) in meeting the goals of the Paris Agreement and will expand the ongoing NDC Support Programme. It will focus on supporting countries to accelerate NDC implementation, making the case for NDCs as a development opportunity; securing financing needed to deliver these plans; integrating NDC targets and actions into national and sectoral plans and budgets, mobilization of society to contribute to and demand greater climate action that meets SDG targets. It will also help countries shift to cleaner and renewable sources of energy with the primary entry point being the NDCs, and in relation to innovative financing for climate resilience the programme can help catalyze blended finance and private sector-oriented solutions to address key climate issues related to coastal resilience, resilient agriculture and food systems, resilient water management, and urban resilience. The two sub-programmes and results areas are: 1) Scaling up Climate Change Action through NDCs and 2) Shifting to Cleaner and Renewable Energy Sources. D. Nexus area: Sustainable Food Systems – Mobilising Government, Businesses, Communities and Investors for Transforming the Food System Transitioning to a more sustainable global food system that meets dietary and nutritional needs of the growing population requires integrated approaches that address challenges and opportunities around the efficiencies of food production and distribution at a global scale. Agriculture is the largest driver of deforestation, degradation of ecosystem services, and biodiversity loss. At the same time, essential ecosystem services need to be preserved including water, fertile soil and pollinators and broader biodiversity. A shift is therefore needed so as to harness the power of nature including the genetic diversity of crops, plants and livestock, and more sustainable systems of food production, and land and water management, which cuts across all the other three programme areas. The results under the programme will include; 1) Commodities platform and a road-map for deforestation free commitments, 2) Small-holder farmers have access to finance for transforming commodities practices, 3) Farm systems are practicing biodiversity conserving and climate resilient farming in pilot LDCs, 4) Integrating agro-biodiversity index in monitoring systems, and 5) Food systems policies that promote gender equality and participation.

tag.narrative: 1.4 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla män och kvinnor, i synnerhet de fattiga och de utsatta, har lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, tillgång till grundläggande tjänster, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till arv, naturresurser, lämplig ny teknik och finansiella tjänster, inklusive mikrokrediter.

1.4 - By 2030, ensure that all men and women, in particular the poor and the vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to basic services, ownership and control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources, appropriate new technology and financial services, including microfinance.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.
13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.2 - Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning.
13.2 - Integrera klimatåtgärder i politik, strategier och planering på nationell nivå.

14.2 - By 2020, sustainably manage and protect marine and coastal ecosystems to avoid significant adverse impacts, including by strengthening their resilience, and take action for their restoration in order to achieve healthy and productive oceans.

14.2 - Senast 2020 förvalta och skydda marina och kustnära ekosystem på ett hållbart sätt för att undvika betydande negativa konsekvenser, bland annat genom att stärka deras motståndskraft, samt vidta åtgärder för att återställa dem i syfte att uppnå friska och produktiva hav.

15.1 - Till 2020 bevara, återställa och hållbart använda ekosystem på land och i sötvatten och deras ekosystemtjänster, särskilt skogar, våtmarker, berg och torra områden, i enlighet med de skyldigheter som anges i internationella överenskommelser.

15.1 - By 2020, ensure the conservation, restoration and sustainable use of terrestrial and inland freshwater ecosystems and their services, in particular forests, wetlands, mountains and drylands, in line with obligations under international agreements.
15.5 - Take urgent and significant action to reduce the degradation of natural habitats, halt the loss of biodiversity and, by 2020, protect and prevent the extinction of threatened species.

15.5 - Vidta omedelbara och betydande åtgärder för att minska förstörelsen av naturliga livsmiljöer, hejda förlusten av biologisk mångfald och senast 2020 skydda och förebygga utrotning av hotade arter.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.
6.5 - By 2030, implement integrated water resources management at all levels, including through transboundary cooperation as appropriate.
6.5 - Senast 2030 genomföra en integrerad förvaltning av vattenresurser på alla nivåer, när så är lämpligt genom gränsöverskridande samarbete.
7.1 - By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services.
7.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa allmän tillgång till ekonomiskt överkomliga, tillförlitliga och moderna energitjänster.

strategy.title: Sustainable environment, climate, oceans and use of natural resources 2018-2022
strategy.titleSV: Hållbar miljö, hållbart klimat och hav samt hållbart nyttj. av naturresurser 2018-2022
